On Apr 29, 2004, at 11:40 AM, John Lindwall wrote:

> Does anyone out there actually use Abbot?

yes, there might be one or two people :)

>
> I had tried it over a year ago and found it too flaky and buggy to 
> actually seriously use.  We tried it again last week and still had 
> nothing but problems with it.  It has so much potential but I just 
> can't seem to make it perform as advertised.
>
> John

There is an abbot user's list where you can find out if you're simply 
taking the wrong approach, or point out faulty documentation, or 
contribute your experiences.  Traffic is moderate.

bug reports usually help to get something fixed, and they're easy to 
file at http://sourceforge.net/tracker/?group_id=50939&atid=461490.  
Releases come out regularly, and CVS is available for those that want 
to add things the authors consider to be warts.

of course, this junit discussion group isn't likely to respond to abbot 
bug reports.


>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Timothy Wall [mailto:twall@...]
> Sent: Thursday, April 29, 2004 5:55 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] GUI Testing problem plz help
>
>
> invoke the dialog "show" on a different thread from your main test
> thread.
>
> the abbot framework (abbot.sf.net) provides a junit TestCase extension
> with facilities to aid in doing this sort of thing regularly.
>
subject: Re: [junit] GUI Testing problem plz help
